data.meta_description: We're thrilled to welcome Frank Fischer an industry leader with over 40 years of senior management experience in the medical device field, as the new Chairmanâ€¦
data.text:
We're thrilled to welcome Gerardo de la Concha, an industry expert in the field of Medical Device manufacturing, as a Senior Advisor of Manufacturing and Operations at CoMind. Gerardo joined Medtronic in 1998 as Vice-president of Operations at Medtronic to establish the first Medtronic manufacturing plant in Mexico and he grew the operation into the largest single manufacturing plant for Medtronic. He also was responsible for the manufacturing plant in Sonora Mexico overlooking over 5,500 employees. In this role Gerardo was responsible for shaping the strategy for manufacturing operations in Mexico and establishing a World Class Manufacturing Center of Excellence in Tijuana Mexico. In addition to that he optimized the manufacturing operations in Puerto Rico and Santa Ana, California. At Medtronic, Gerardo was a member of the CEO Council to drive diversity and the Blueprint for change strategy requested by Bill Hawkins. Before working for Medtronic, Gerardo worked for American Optical for 13 years and 3M for five years in different roles. Gerardo holds a BS in Industrial Engineering for Universidad Iberoamericana and a Diploma in Businesses Administration for ITESM in Mexico City, and he also attended UCLA Anderson School of Business. At CoMind, we are on a mission to transform the way the brain is measured and treated to optimize patient outcomes across the care continuum. Gerardo's extensive experience and guidance, will assist in creating innovative products that help clinicians to better understand the brain, deliver improved care and let millions of people around the world to live healthier lives. Welcome to CoMind, Gerardo! ðŸŽ‰

CoMind is thrilled to announce the addition of a new leader to the team: Xavier Lefebvre as our Vice-President of Clinical. Xavier is a veteran of the medical technology industry with a career spanning more than 30 years. He has built and led clinical research and clinical operations for medical technology start-ups, as well as industry leaders such as Boston Scientific, Covidien and Medtronic. His experience combines extensive global clinical program strategy development and execution experience with strong clinical technology know-how. Xavier brings efficient and effective operational expertise for rapid global regulatory clearances and revenue growth in highly regulated markets (US, Europe, China, Japan). Xavier will join CoMind part-time. CoMind welcomes Xavier to the team and is excited to start this journey with him!
